item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Shakes Up How Shiny Pokemon Spawns Work
item.description:
Pokemon Legends: Z-A has made a big change to the way that Shiny Pokemon spawn, which could potentially make it a lot easier for players to capture them. Opinions on the change are mixed, with some feeling that Pokemon Legends: Z-A is taking a step in the right direction, while others prefer the old way of doing things.

Shiny Pokemon have been a big deal for as long as they've been in the series, as they are a rare variation that can be hard to come by. Shiny Pokemon don't offer any significant benefits over their standard versions, but they tend to impress the community, making fans covet them.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Changes How Shinies Spawn

Now, players have discovered that there seems to be a significant change made to the way that Shiny spawns work in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . In the event that a player is lucky enough to have a Shiny Pokemon spawn on the map, those Shiny Pokemon will no longer despawn unless they run away from a battle or are purposefully chased off by a player. Numerous players have tested this, and discovered that while some Shiny spawns will disappear temporarily when the time of day changes, they'll return during their normal spawning hours in the same location they were originally spotted in. Walking away, zoning, or even restarting the game doesn't cause the Shinies to disappear anymore.

As long-time fans of the series know, this is a major change that could eliminate some headaches with Shiny hunting. Plenty of fans have been through the experience of spotting a Shiny only to lose it because they got too far away, or were interrupted by another Pokemon battle, or even something as simple as having their system's battery die, forcing them to reset the game. While there are mixed feelings about Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's auto-save system, players won't have to worry about the auto-save ruining their chances at a Shiny.

As noted, fans are having a mixed reaction to this news. Some are delighted, as it should make it harder to lose Shinies by accident. However, others feel that this move devalues Shinies, as it eliminates a lot of the chance and challenge involved in spotting and successfully catching them. It's also likely that this move could lead to a lot more Shinies per player, and since Pokemon Legends: Z-A will be integrated with Pokemon Home in 2026, that could mean more Shinies in the overall Pokemon population.

5.2 /10

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: These 10/10 RPGs All Have Overwhelmingly Positive Steam Reviews
item.description:
The RPG genre has been thriving in the past couple of years, both on home consoles and on PC. As a result, digital storefronts like Steam are brimming with high-quality releases that have already gained massive followings, from indie titles to AAA projects.

With so many 10/10 titles to choose from, RPG enthusiasts may have a hard time deciding which games to buy on Steam. Checking out their reviews on their respective pages is always a good first step. For those that are still looking for a concrete recommendation, the following RPGs all have "Overwhelmingly Positive" reviews on the platform, and theyâ€™re worth adding to any collection.

South Park: The Stick Of Truth

A Comedic RPG With Gameplay Similar To Paper Mario

South Park: The Stick of Truth
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
March 4, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Violence
Powered by

After many decades of low-quality releases, the critically acclaimed adult animated series South Park finally got its first good video game adaptation in 2014, in the form of South Park: The Stick of Truth . This time around, Matt Stone and Trey Parker worked closely with Obsidian Entertainment to ensure that the final product would not only have the seriesâ€™ signature style of humor, but that it would also play well.

Needless to say, they did not disappoint. The Stick of Truth is an accessible but endlessly entertaining turn-based RPG that keeps the player engaged with timed button inputs, in a combat system thatâ€™s reminiscent of the Paper Mario series. On top of that, its writing and its story are as hilarious, clever, and raunchy as one would expect from this IP, to the point that it feels like an unofficial South Park movie. Its sequel, The Fractured But Whole , is also a great game, but it only has "Very Positive" reviews on Steam.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Changed The Gaming Landscape Forever

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
56
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt may be the third entry in the Witcher series, but it's the game that put both the IP and its developer, CD Projekt Red, on the map. Even though it came at a time in which western action RPGs were losing popularity, it still received glowing reviews from fans and critics alike, even winning the Game of the Year award in 2015.

But, what makes The Witcher 3 so special? That question is almost impossible to answer in just a few words. Itâ€™s overall a beautifully made RPG. Geralt of Rivia is a cool but complex main character, the monsters he has to slay are terrifying, and the world is brimming with interesting characters and fun side-quests to complete. The gameplay loop is addicting and the graphics are so detailed that they still hold up, even ten years after its initial release.

Undertale / Deltarune

Toby Foxâ€™s Bizarre But Charming Pacifist RPGs

Undertale
11
9.6 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

In 2015, Toby Fox and his team revolutionized the Indie RPG scene by releasing Undertale , a unique turn-based RPG with bullet hell combat that encouraged players to not kill enemies, and to solve conflicts in a pacifist way instead. Combine that with its amazing soundtrack, its emotional storyline, its zany sense of humor, and its low price, and itâ€™s understandable why Undertale became a cult classic so quickly.

But that was not enough for Toby Fox and company. A few years later, they released chapter 1 of Deltarune , a spiritual successor to Undertale and the game the famous indie developer always wanted to make. Deltarune is better in every way, with a more complex combat system, better music, more colorful and detailed graphics, and a longer, more interesting plot. Even though only four chapters have been released so far, each one of them is brimming with style and content. Both Undertale and Deltarune have "Overwhelmingly Positive" reviews on Steam, and they definitely live up to their reputation.

Persona 5 Royal

One Of The Best Turn-Based JRPGs Ever Made

Persona 5 Royal
10 /10
17
9.5 /10
Released
March 31, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

The Persona series has always been popular, but Persona 5 turned it into a worldwide phenomenon with a massive fan base. Fortunately for those interested in trying it out, after a few years of PlayStation exclusivity, its enhanced port, Persona 5 Royal , was released on Steam in 2022.

The heart and soul of this game are the Phantom Thieves, a group of teenagers who use their powers to enter the minds of corrupt people in order to change them for good. Aside from its brilliant concept, its lovable characters, and its intriguing story, the gameplay of Persona 5 Royal also contributed to its well-deserved popularity, combining a dynamic turn-based combat system with cozy life simulation mechanics. Lastly, the stylish anime-like graphics and catchy soundtrack are another important part of its unique identity.

Hades

An Accessible, Addictive Rogue-Like Action RPG

Hades
10 /10
17
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Rogue-likes are not for everyone, but Supergiant Gamesâ€™ Hades is one of the most accessible ones out there, which is why this game has been praised so much since its 2020 release. Players take control of Zagreus, the son of the titular Hades, who has to escape from the Underworld by exploring many different dungeons and defeat hordes of enemies inside them.

The combat of Hades is incredibly fast-paced, and the progression system is satisfying, as it rewards exploration, experimentation and resilience. Befriending all the different gods and monsters from Greek Mythology is also very fun, seeing as they were brought to life with beautiful art and clever writing. At the end of the day, Hades is an addictive game that was designed to be replayed over and over. Now is the best time to try this indie masterpiece out, seeing as its direct sequel, Hades 2 , just came out in September 2025.

Yakuza: Like A Dragon

Turned Like A Dragon Into An RPG Franchise

Yakuza: Like A Dragon
9.5 /10
Released
November 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

The Like a Dragon games (previously known as Yakuza ) are well-known for being wacky but endearing beat 'em ups. However, everything changed for this franchise in 2020, with the unexpected release of Yakuza: Like a Dragon . This entry ditched the seriesâ€™ signature real-time action gameplay in favor of a turn-based combat system. Despite all odds, it ended up being a colossal critical and commercial success.

Shifting genres within a franchise is always a controversial choice, but Like a Dragon fans embraced the turn-based RPG gameplay because it maintained everything that had made the franchise so special in the first place. Itâ€™s enjoyable, dynamic, and over-the-top, not to mention that the rest of the adventure has a lot of fun secondary activities and silly distractions that the player can complete at their own leisure. Fans of this game should also check out its direct follow-up, 2024â€™s Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth (which isnâ€™t on this list because it has "Very Positive" reviews on Steam).

Baldur's Gate 3

A Well-Deserved Game Of The Year Win

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
145
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

There are multiple solid Dungeons & Dragons video games on Steam, but Baldur's Gate 3 is arguably the absolute best one, as it has become so big that it even attracted gamers who had never tried out these types of games before. This award-winning title took everything that makes the iconic tabletop RPG so engaging, and translated into an addictive digital adventure.

From the moment players create their own custom character, it becomes evident that Baldur's Gate 3 is brimming with options that make each playthrough different from the last. The game offers a deep combat system that switches things up depending on the player characterâ€™s class, background, and party. With a multitude of important choices to make, a cast of lovable and well-written characters, and a fascinating storyline full of twists and turns, it should be no surprise that Baldur's Gate 3 won Game of the Year award in 2023. It even managed to beat other excellent titles like Tears of the Kingdom and Alan Wake 2 in the process.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

A Brand-New IP That Captivated Gamers Around The World

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
165
9.2 /10
Released
April 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

The RPG genre has been dominated by famous AAA franchises for years, so itâ€™s not common to see a brand-new IP become so popular so quickly, especially outside the Indie scene. Fortunately, this is exactly what happened this year with Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , which gained so much critical acclaim that it's already considered the best game of 2025 by many.

Developed by a team of around thirty people, the main selling point of Clair Obscur is its brilliant combat system, which utilizes real-time quick-time events to make the action more engaging, refreshing, and fast-paced. Its gorgeous presentation, its interesting and lovable characters and its rich narrative also contributed to this gameâ€™s massive popularity. At the end of the day, Clair Obscur is so well-made and so groundbreaking that it even succeeded in turning thousands of RPG haters into new fans of the genre.

item.title: Megabonk: Best Ninja Build
item.description:
In Megabonk , Ninja is one of those characters that feels so satisfying to play with once you get the hang of him. At first, he seems hard to control, but once you learn how to use his evasion-based playstyle in Megabonk , Ninja turns into a silent killer capable of tearing through waves in seconds.

Heâ€™s definitely not a beginner-friendly pick in Megabonk . One bad dodge with Ninja can end your run right there. However, if you can stay calm and time your moves, Ninja is arguably one of the best characters in Megabonk . This guide covers the best weapons, tomes, and items for Ninja.

Best Weapons for Ninja in Megabonk

Ninja starts with the Katana. It starts off with a short range, but with the right upgrades and tomes, the Katana turns into a sweeping, multi-hit blade that can clear entire crowds in one swing.

Here are the best weapon options for Ninja:

  • Katana (Starter): The core of Ninjaâ€™s build. It scales perfectly with Size and Damage boosts, and pairs incredibly well with Quantity Tome for rapid slashes.
  • Aura : Adds constant AoE damage around you, perfect for cleaning up smaller enemies while you focus on dodging.
  • Lightning Staff : Gives reliable crowd control. It zaps enemies from a distance, giving you breathing space during chaotic waves.

If you havenâ€™t unlocked Aura or Lightning Staff yet, Axe and Bone are decent early substitutes. They will give you steady melee support until your main setup comes together.

Best Tomes for Ninja in Megabonk

In Megabonk , Tomes are what shape Ninja into a real execution machine. Since his Execute passive instantly kills enemies when you dodge their attacks, your goal should always be to stack evasion. Use Tomes like:

  • Evasion Tome : This is the most important choice for Ninja. Every point of evasion increases your survival rate and the number of instant kills you can trigger.
  • Size Tome : This Tome extends the Katanaâ€™s reach, letting you slice through larger groups with each swing.
  • Damage Tome : Helps your attacks hit harder, especially against elites and bosses that canâ€™t be instantly executed.
  • Quantity Tome : This Tome adds additional slashes per attack, turning Ninja into a spinning whirlwind of blades.

Best Items for Ninja in Megabonk

Ninjaâ€™s items should focus on three things: staying alive, staying fast, and dealing consistent damage. Since heâ€™s naturally fragile, your gear should make dodging easier and reward you for every close call.

For early and mid-game, choose Phantom Shroud and Slippery Ring . Phantom Shroud increases both speed and damage after successful dodges, letting Ninja chain kills effortlessly. On the other hand, Slippery Ring adds a flat evasion boost.

After getting past the early waves, items like Backpack and Forbidden Juice are great for expanding your inventory and increasing damage output.

9.3 /10

Megabonk

item.title: Best Games For Living A Medieval Life
item.description:
Games are often played as an escape, and what could be more different from the technology and screens of the modern world than the tranquility of rural medieval life? While some medieval games focus on combat, including longsword duels and cavalry charges, others allow players to experience the day in the life of a medieval blacksmith, farmer, or merchant.

These games can be relaxing, teach players about history, and yet are still fun and rewarding. With games set in the Middle Ages becoming more and more popular thanks to the success of titles such as Kingdom Come: Deliverance and Manor Lords , players can also check out these new upcoming medieval games, some of which will supposedly allow players to experience daily life.

Medieval Dynasty

Farm, Craft, Cook, Fish, Forage, & Fight

Medieval Dynasty
Open-World
Strategy
8.0 /10

Released
December 17, 2020
ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

If players are looking for a relaxing experience of medieval life via the medium of video games, then look no further than Medieval Dynasty â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹. At first, it is somewhat of a survival game, as players must forage for food and gather resources to build shelter. However, it won't take long for players to start building their own village and populating it with farmhands, hunters, and craftsmen.

From then on, players can enjoy many aspects of rural medieval life, all in first or third person. They can chop trees, plow, plant, and harvest the fields over the changing seasons, hunt, fish, cook, craft, build, and much more with the aim of growing the village into a thriving town. The open world also allows players to take on the roles of medieval merchants or adventurers. Best of all, Medieval Dynasty can be enjoyed with friends in co-op, and while it does have some historical inaccuracies, such as a lack of a religion, it is still a highly immersive game.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

The Legacy Of The Forge DLC, In Particular, Lets Henry Live A Medieval Life

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II
RPG
Action-Adventure
Open-World
10 /10
75
9.0 /10

Released
February 4, 2025
ESRB
Mature 17+ / Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity
Developer(s)
Warhorse Studios
Publisher(s)
Deep Silver
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is, without a doubt, the best medieval game ever made, but as an RPG with a huge story and a record amount of dialogue, how much of a simple medieval life can players lead? At a couple of times throughout the main story, players are in more of a rush due to pressing matters. However, most of the time, and particularly after finishing the main quest line, players are free to do what they like, and that includes simulating medieval life.

This is particularly true with the Legacy of the Forge DLC, which sees Henry settle down in Kuttenberg as a blacksmith and member of the guild. He will have daily commissions, invitations to play dice, and much more, while players are also free to go to the tavern for drinks. At his new home, players will have eggs and honey to collect in the morning, a kitchen to cook in, and herbs to gather. Plenty of the side quests also see Henry engage in different medieval livelihoods. For example, he can work in a vineyard, help out at a mill, and there are, of course, plenty of opportunities to play as a warrior.

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

Play As A Merchant, Blacksmith, Or Mercenary

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord
Action RPG
Strategy
8.0 /10

Released
October 25, 2022
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
TaleWorlds Entertainment
Publisher(s)
TaleWorlds Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord is mostly about warfare, and if players want to live the life of a medieval mercenary, soldier, or bandit in a large simulated sandbox, then this is a great option. However, for those who like to taste other elements of life in the Middle Ages, there are thankfully a few other options outside of combat.

For example, players can take on the role of a merchant, traveling far and wide across the large map, buying rare goods cheaply where they are produced and then selling them for more in towns where the demand is higher. Trade has also been expanded with the War Sails DLC, which allows the transportation of goods via ships. On land and at sea, merchants will have to be wary of bandits and so must travel with a guard. There is also the option to become a medieval blacksmith with plenty of options for customization, although this won't be performed in person like the best games for playing as a blacksmith.

The Guild Franchise

Choose One Of Many Professions & Grow Your Business

The Guild 2

Released
September 15, 2006
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

For those who prefer the hustle and bustle of life in a prosperous town in the late Middle Ages, The Guild franchise offers some fantastic experiences of daily life. While The Guild III is the most recent with the best graphics, many of the reviews suggest sticking with the first two games, and if players like these, they should keep an eye on The Guild - Europa 1410, which aims to revitalize the series.

In essence, The Guild games allow players to choose a profession and grow their business, bringing wealth and respect to their family. The list of medieval professions includes farmers, bakers, innkeepers, millers, fishermen, smiths, tailors, carpenters, stonemasons, priests, thieves, merchants, and more.

Bellwright

Similar To Medieval Dynasty, But With More Combat

Bellwright
Survival
Open-World
RPG
8.0 /10

Released
April 23, 2024
ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Donkey Crew
Publisher(s)
Snail Games USA, Donkey Crew
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Bellwright is an Early Access, medieval survival game, similar to Medieval Dynasty , but with a greater emphasis on combat as the player's village can be raided, and they are tasked with conquering other settlements. Nevertheless, players are still able to hunt, fish, build, and experience other aspects of rural life in the Middle Ages outside of combat.

All of this is done in third person and can be enjoyed alongside friends via online co-op. There is also a large emphasis on recruiting NPCs, both as workers in the village and warriors on the battlefield.

item.title: World of Warcraft: Legion Remix Lets Players Get an Unexpected Reward
item.description:
World of Warcraft fans can earn five Keystone Hero Mythic+ dungeon teleports during the Legion Remix limited-time event. Though it is usually difficult to obtain Keystone Hero achievements after their respective expansions, World of Warcraft has made an exception for Legion Remix .

From hundreds of achievements to dozens of transmogs, pets, mounts, toys, and more, there are many rewards players can get in World of Warcraft: Legion Remix . While they can unlock brand-new items like Housing Decor, they can also earn returning rewards that are difficult or impossible to get in modern WoW .

World of Warcraft: Legion Remix Keystone Hero Dungeon Teleports

That said, the return of some of these rewards in particular came as quite a surprise to fans. With each expansion since their introduction, players could earn Keystone Hero achievements for each Mythic+ dungeon by clearing them at the +20 difficulty, after which they would unlock a teleport that takes players directly to their respective instance entrances on an eight-hour cooldown. Normally, these achievements go away once these dungeons leave the Keystone rotation â€“ but since Mythic+ dungeons are available in World of Warcraft: Legion Remix at max level, fans can earn five previously available Keystone Hero achievements and their respective teleports during the limited-time event, with a sixth presumably coming in a future phase.

Return to Karazhan is unavailable in Legion Remix until October 21. Once it is added in the Rise of the Nightfallen phase, its Keystone Hero achievement will ostensibly become obtainable.

  • Black Rook Hold
  • Court of Stars
  • Darkheart Thicket
  • Halls of Valor
  • Neltharion's Lair
  • Return to Karazhan (likely arriving October 21 in Phase 2)

When Legion Remix first started, some players were surprised to find that these Keystone Hero achievements were unlockable. However, World of Warcraft quickly disabled them, implying it was an unintentional perk they were not planning on giving out. After much fan feedback, Blizzard has now re-enabled these achievements and confirmed they will be available to earn during all of Legion Remix .

Gamers should definitely consider trying to earn these achievements in World of Warcraft: Legion Remix if they can. None of these dungeons are currently in the Mythic+ rotation for The War Within Season 3, and completing a conventional Mythic+ 20 is pretty challenging. On the converse, the endless power levels of World of Warcraft: Legion Remix mean one can not only easily complete Mythic+ Keystones of 30 or higher, but some players are even able to solo Mythic+ 20s. Needless to say, there may never be a better opportunity to earn these teleports than Legion Remix .

Unfortunately, World of Warcraft did not come to the same conclusion with the Artifact Weapon appearances from the Mage Tower. Though a glitch temporarily allowed Druids to unlock these restricted shapeshifting forms, World of Warcraft has since removed these options and has no intention of re-enabling them. While fans are able to unlock the Keystone Hero teleports, those who missed out on the original Mage Tower appearances during Legion are still out of luck.

20
9.4 /10

World of Warcraft: The War Within

Follow
Followed
Released
August 26, 2024
Base Game
World of Warcraft
Developer(s)
Blizzard
Publisher(s)
Blizzard

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

In this opening chapter of The Worldsoul Saga, youâ€™ll journey through never-before-seen subterranean worlds filled with hidden wonders and lurking perils, down to the dark depths of the Nerubian empire, where the inscrutable Harbinger of the Void has gathered her arachnid forces to bring Azeroth to its knees.
